Rare disease patients have complex clinical representations. Patients with Lissencephaly 2 present clinical features that include: seizures, developmental delay, motor impairment, intellectual disability, hypotonia, dysmorphic features, and microcephaly. The majority of patients with Lissencephaly 2 have an IQ below 70.

Lissencephaly 2 is a rare disease with an incidence of 1 in 100,000 live births.
